markdownRemark.html:
Today I launched a couple of online surveys in order to learn a few things about people habits, and their interest in the app. I asked about peoples habits to see what people struggle with the most, so if I decide to narrow the focus of the app I will have some idea of where to point it.

In this post I’m going to talk about each survey, and what I learned from the initial results, and what I could have done better.

Small-scale social survey

I launched a survey through a couple of my social media channels and also on Reddit to gather information.

Pros:

Detailed answers Free

Cons:

Harder to get people to engage in the survey. Results can be skewed if the participent knows you through social media.

Large-scale “worker” survey

I used one of Amazon’s services called mTurk to “purchase” survey results. For only a few pounds I was able to get 76 participents to do the survey.
